mn-state-house.title: State House
mn-state-house.description: All 134 Minnesota House members are up for re-election every two years. You can find your district here. Most are uncontested. Not listed below are the primaries for a special state Senate election for the St. Cloud-area seat of former state Sen. Michelle Fischbach, who resigned in May to assume the office of lieutenant governor. Republican Jeff Howe and DFLer Joe Perske are uncontested in their primaries and will face off in November.

mn-us-senate-class-1.title: Scheduled
mn-us-senate-class-1.description: Democrat Amy Klobuchar has held this seat since 2007.

mn-us-senate-class-2.title: Special
mn-us-senate-class-2.description: Sen. Tina Smith was appointed to this seat in January after Sen. Al Franken stepped down. The timing of his resignation triggered an off-cycle election for the seat. It will be up for election again in 2020.

mn-us-house-district-1.title: District 1
mn-us-house-district-1.description: Minnesota's southernmost congressional district includes Rochester, Faribault, Mankato and Albert Lea. DFLer Tim Walz held this seat for more than a decade before vacating it to run for governor this year.

mn-us-house-district-2.title: District 2
mn-us-house-district-2.description: Stretching southeast along the Misssissippi River from the Twin Cities' southern suburbs, the Second District includes Belle Plaine, Prior Lake, Northfield, Red Wing and Wabasha. Republican Jason Lewis is running for a second term as its congressman.

mn-us-house-district-3.title: District 3
mn-us-house-district-3.description: The Third District spans much of the outer west metro and includes Plymouth, Eden Prairie and Rogers. It has frequently been home to one of the nation's most expensive U.S. House races. As of the end of June, both Dean Phillips and Rep. Erik Paulsen had each spent about $1.3 million on their campaigns.

mn-us-house-district-4.title: District 4
mn-us-house-district-4.description: This east metro district includes St. Paul, Roseville, Woodbury and White Bear Lake. The district has been controlled by the DFL since 1949 and is currently held by nine-term DFL Rep. Betty McCollum.

mn-us-house-district-5.title: District 5
mn-us-house-district-5.description: Covering most of Minneapolis and the western inner-ring suburbs, the Fifth District has been in DFL hands since 1963. Rep. Keith Ellison's decision to run for attorney general leaves this seat open for just the third time in the last 75 years.

mn-us-house-district-6.title: District 6
mn-us-house-district-6.description: The solidly Republican Sixth District sprawls northwest from the Twin Cities' outer-ring suburbs to Stearns County, including St. Cloud, Delano, Crystal and Coon Rapids. Rep. Tom Emmer has represented it since 2015.

mn-us-house-district-7.title: District 7
mn-us-house-district-7.description: Encompassing much of the western half of the state, from the Canadian border to Marshall in the south, the Seventh is Minnesota's largest district. According to Cook Political Report, it is the most solidly Republican district in the nation currently represented by a Democrat, Rep. Collin Peterson.

mn-us-house-district-8.title: District 8
mn-us-house-district-8.description: Republicans view the Eighth District, historically a DFL stronghold that includes the Arrowhead region and much of the Iron Range, as one of their best pick-up opportunities in 2018 with the retirement of DFL Rep. Rick Nolan.

mn-governor.title: Minnesota Governor
mn-governor.description: The open governor's race got more interesting this spring when neither party's slate of candidates yielded to the endorsed candidate.

mn-attorney-general.title: Minnesota Attorney General
mn-attorney-general.description: After relatively unknown Matt Pelikan won the DFL endorsement over incumbent Lori Swanson, she exited the race to run for governor, setting off a domino effect of other candidate filings. Among other things, this led to Rep. Keith Ellison throwing his hat in the ring, suddenly opening up his Fifth District congressional seat.

mn-state-house-district-6-b.title: District 6B
mn-state-house-district-6-b.description: North of Duluth, including Eveleth, Virginia and Hoyt Lakes

mn-state-house-district-15-b.title: District 15B
mn-state-house-district-15-b.description: East, north and south of St. Cloud, including Rice, Foley and Becker

mn-state-house-district-18-a.title: District 18A
mn-state-house-district-18-a.description: Litchfield, Dassel and part of Hutchinson

mn-state-house-district-22-a.title: District 22A
mn-state-house-district-22-a.description: Rural southwest border with South Dakota, including Pipestone and Luverne

mn-state-house-district-31-b.title: District 31B
mn-state-house-district-31-b.description: North metro suburbs, including Ham Lake and East Bethel

mn-state-house-district-40-b.title: District 40B
mn-state-house-district-40-b.description: Brooklyn Center and eastern Brooklyn Park

mn-state-house-district-41-b.title: District 41B
mn-state-house-district-41-b.description: St. Anthony, Columbia Heights, New Brighton and Hilltop

mn-state-house-district-47-b.title: District 47B
mn-state-house-district-47-b.description: Southwest metro, including Chaska, southwest Chanhassen and northeast Victoria

mn-state-house-district-53-a.title: District 53A
mn-state-house-district-53-a.description: East of St. Paul, including southern Maplewood, western Woodbury and Landfall

mn-state-house-district-55-a.title: District 55A
mn-state-house-district-55-a.description: Southwest metro, including Shakopee and Jackson and Louisville townships

mn-state-house-district-57-a.title: District 57A
mn-state-house-district-57-a.description: South metro, including southern Apple Valley and northeast Lakeville

mn-state-house-district-59-a.title: District 59A
mn-state-house-district-59-a.description: North Minneapolis, including Shingle Creek, Lind-Bohanon, Victory, Webber-Camden, Cleveland, Folwell, McKinley, Jordan and Hawthorne neighborhoods

mn-state-house-district-59-b.title: District 59B
mn-state-house-district-59-b.description: North and downtown Minneapolis, including Elliot Park, North Loop, Bryn Mawr, Harrison, Willard-Hay and Near North neighborhoods

mn-state-house-district-60-b.title: District 60B
mn-state-house-district-60-b.description: University area of Minneapolis, including Marcy-Holmes, Dinkytown, Como, Cedar-Riverside, northern Seward and Prospect Park neighborhoods

mn-state-house-district-62-a.title: District 62A
mn-state-house-district-62-a.description: South of downtown Minneapolis, including Stevens Square, Ventura Village, Whittier, northeast Lyn-Lake and Phillips neighborhoods

mn-state-house-district-62-b.title: District 62B
mn-state-house-district-62-b.description: Central and south Minneapolis, including Lyndale, Powderhorn, Kingfield, Bryant, Regina and Tangletown neighborhoods

mn-state-house-district-66-b.title: District 66B
mn-state-house-district-66-b.description: Northern St. Paul, including Como, northern North End and eastern Payne-Phalen neighborhoods
